title: Pluribus
overview: The most miserable person on Earth must save the world from happiness.
reason: Critically acclaimed with an 87 Metacritic score and 8.1 IMDb rating from over 76K votes. Created by Vince Gilligan (Breaking Bad) and starring Rhea Seehorn (Better Call Saul) on Apple TV.

title: IT: Welcome to Derry
overview: In 1962, amid a spate of unexplained disappearances of local children, a group of misfit friends begin to suspect a long-buried ancient evil lurking. As the kids set out to determine what's really going on, a rising unease prompts several townspeople to work together to restore peace – all while a U.S. military operation seeks to exploit Derry for its own objectives.
reason: Highly anticipated prequel on HBO, boasting an 8.0 IMDb rating from over 71K votes, and helmed by the acclaimed creators of the 'IT' film franchise.

title: Monster: The Ed Gein Story
overview: The shocking true-life tale of Ed Gein, the infamous murderer and grave robber who inspired many of Hollywood's most iconic on-screen killers.
reason: This installment of Netflix's immensely popular 'Monster' anthology series, associated with Ryan Murphy and starring Charlie Hunnam, is poised for significant cultural impact and viewership.

title: Boots
overview: After impulsively joining the U.S. Marine Corps, a bullied teen finds new purpose — and unexpected brotherhood — with his motley team of fellow recruits.
reason: A strong performer on Netflix with a 7.9 IMDb rating from over 22K votes and a 73 Metacritic score, featuring well-known actress Vera Farmiga.

title: The Beast in Me
overview: A famous author is pulled into a twisted mind game with her rich, powerful new neighbor — who might be a murderer.
reason: Attracts significant attention with Emmy-winning leads Claire Danes and Matthew Rhys, achieving a 7.5 IMDb rating from over 21K votes on Netflix.
